But, like, why is no one talking about this book???!!!

‚ú® Swipe to see the gorgeous cover üòç‚ú®

The Arc was creepy, romantic, and heartbreaking. And the ending was one for the ages!!!

Here‚Äôs a brief synopsis:

Thirty-five-year-old Ursula Byrne, VP of Strategic Audacity at a branding agency in Manhattan, is successful, witty, whip-smart, and single. She‚Äôs tried all the dating apps, and let‚Äôs just say: she‚Äôs underwhelmed by her options. You‚Äôd think that by now someone would have come up with something more bespoke; a way for users to be more tailored about who and what they want in a life partner‚Äì‚Äìhow hard could that be?

Enter The Arc: a highly secretive, super-sophisticated matchmaking service that uses a complex series of emotional, psychological and physiological assessments to architect partnerships that will go the distance. The price tag is high, the promise ambitious‚Äì‚Äìa level of lifelong compatibility that would otherwise be unattainable. In other words, The Arc will find your ideal mate.

Out on 2/8/22!!!

Thank you to @stmartinspress and @netgalley for the advanced copy.

I am extremely bad at relationships. In my almost 20 year of grown up life, I have managed to spend a staggering 4 year in something you could kind of call a relationship.

And don‚Äôt get me started on finding romance while being a mostly introverted, but at the same time very outspoken book nerd with social anxiety in her thirties. 

So I was intrigued when I spotted this book in a second hand store. I mean comedians are not exactly known to be the romantic types and well, bad relationships make for great comedy. So I was hoping to maybe learn a bit and have some laughs.

And I have to say, my expectations where shattered. The book was funny, quite informative and well written. And also just pretty. As I am not exactly the shiny social butterfly type, that can meet people everywhere, I have been on dating apps for a while now and so reading about other peoples struggles with them and a lot of interesting facts and statistics, was kind of calming and encouraging.

Also learning about the dating culture in other countries was eye opening. I guess we are quite happy here in Estonia that we don‚Äôt have such strong stereotypes, like the herbivore men of Tokyo and the very carnivorous no-is-just-a-prelude-for-yes men in Buenos Aires.

If there is only one thing to take away from this book, it‚Äôs that we don‚Äôt live in a mystical world where your other perfect half is out there somewhere. You got to give people a chance and put work into getting to know someone and building a relationship that lasts.

Modern Romance by Aziz Ansari and Eric Klinenberg
Pulblished in 2015

Btw, I also loved that the book had a price tag from a second hand bookstore on it, which means, I am at least its third owner. Re-use for the win!

This is for mature readers. 

I loved this book.  I loved how the nanny interacts with the kids.  I loved how the love interests interacted.  What I really loved the most is that it addresses several serious issues.  It didn't just mention them but incorporated them into the story. The people in this book grew. I laughed and cried while reading this book. It also had many steamy scenes.

This book is currently a prime reading book.

Annabel Monaghan
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è (they all get 5 stars) 

Some of the contemporary romance novels aren't the *best* written literary works. Nora Goes Off Script isn't one of those (it's fantastically written). üíöüíö
Absolutely wonderful. I did a little cry, a bit of a laugh and whole lot of wondering how Annabel Monaghan was going to turn it around. 

If you loved Book Lovers, The Roughest Draft or any Hallmark Romance movie ever made - this one's for you!
Tropes: Nora doesn't really fit too well into any of the regular tropes. But I guess if I had to pigeonhole it's a bit forced proximity & a little bit workplace romance. ‚ù§Ô∏è 

Let me know if you read Nora Goes Off Script and if you liked it as much as I did!! ‚¨áÔ∏è

Read these two back to back and they were very similar in my opinion. I wouldn‚Äôt say I loved either of them (maybe modern romance is just not my thing), but I found myself eager to read the next chapter. Both are great for a quick, entertaining read! #bookstagram #infiveyears #booklovers #modernromancebook #read  #bookstoread

Everyone raves about The Hating Game like Sally Thorne didn't craft this absolute masterpiece. üê¢ 
Second First Impressions is a cardigan and a hug in a book. Which, I'm pretty Thorne knew when she gave her reformed bad-boy the name Teddy. üêª 

If you loved: Get a Life, Chloe Brown
Tropes: Friends to lovers, forced proximity

Updated to Add:

I loved this book. Olive and Adam are a beautiful couple. Talk about a slow burn. This book used just enough jargon to remind me of my time with a PhD candidate in neuroscience but not so much to leave someone confused. Olive‚Äôs personal growth alongside her growing love for Adam was simply adorable. @alihazelwood created a wonderful love story that is instantly on my ‚Äúlend-out‚Äù list. 5/5 would say it lives up to the hype! Laughed out loud at the sunscreen scene and found my hand on my heart when Olive realized the granola bar was covered in chocolate. 

Which Ali Hazelwood book should I read next? 

OP: BOTM has marketed this to me for months now. Is it worth the hype? We all love a good grumpy/sunshine trope. 

There‚Äôs something so exciting about reading a book authored by an actual neuroscientist. The internet is heavily advertising STEMinist lit at me currently. (Looking at you @musicallyyours97 üëÄ)

What‚Äôs your favorite STEMinist romcom? 

#steminist #nerdliterature #modernromancebook #modernromancebooks #feministbook #bookstagram #bookstagrammer #romcombooks

‚ÄúI thought we had agreed that fantasizing about being bent over the kitchen sink does, in fact, constitute a crush?‚Äù

We all need good friends to put us in our place! 

Love Hypothesis was a super fun read that I absolutely devoured but Under One Roof didn't fulfill my craving for more Ali Hazelwood. Not only does this book have a male Asexual character(something that is definitely underepresented in pop culture) but we stan STEM girls. I can't wait to read about Hannah and Sadie. @alihazelwood I need more ASAP ‚ù§Ô∏è

But ever since that first day when Lucy smiled at Josh and he didn‚Äôt smile back, Lucy has been playing the hating game and Josh has been playing a different one‚Ä¶

‚úçÔ∏è: Sonali Dev
üíÖüèº: @essie ‚ÄúBolt and Be Bold,‚Äù ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Hate, Curate‚Äù @urbanoutfitters ‚ÄúApril Showers,‚Äù @inked.bydani branch nail art tattoo, @defyandinspire nail stickers
‚Ä¶
I‚Äôm generally not into modern romance novels, but was in the mood for something light and breezy to get me through a few exhausting days. Dev‚Äôs tale of an affluent immigrant Indian family in San Francisco was a nice, and rather engaging distraction. While I loved the descriptions of the Indian food (so much of which reminds me of Mom‚Äôs Burmese cooking), I don‚Äôt think this changed my mind about modern romance novels. I just can‚Äôt get into them!
‚Ä¶
Completed December 6, 2021.

The Stopover by T L Swan

What happens when you have a stopover.  If you're single, have a fling.  What happens when you come across your fling a year later at your new job, and he's your boss. 

If you want to know read The Stopover by T L Swan.

I really liked this book.  It was set in the world of news reporting.

üìñ‚ú® book review ‚ú®üìñ
‚ÄúInfluenced Love‚Äù is a debut novel, and the first book from the Black Beauty in Love series by Shellee Marie. 

Alivia Fae is a beauty influencer who has a strong, devoted core of ‚ÄúFaes‚Äù who appreciate her honest product reviews and tips - especially because she is a person of color, and addresses concerns for the most underrepresented demographic in the beauty market. She is quite successful, and has turned her influencer passion into her full-time job. She‚Äôs even starting her own beauty product line to provide for others like her who have trouble finding quality, reasonable hair care and beauty products! #girlenterpreneur 
We meet Alivia at her best friend‚Äôs wedding, as his ‚Äúbest woman‚Äù and pick up on some awkwardness right away. Dan looks uneasy, his bride looks livid, and Alivia seems to be harboring guilt/weirdness between she and Dan. As Dan happens to be a pro baseball player, naturally celebrity news starts reporting on Alivia as a speculated homewrecker, attempting to ruin her friend‚Äôs  budding marriage. 
Alivia decides to distract the media and haters by devising a scheme to fake-date fellow influencer, Moe Gava. Queue shenanigans: fake dates, staged photos on cute outings, and an expose interview on the celebrity network channel. To further complicate things, Alivia quickly falls for Moe‚Äôs assistant and friend, Travis! 
Can she untangle this web before her followers find out? Is Moe really a datable guy? What more drama can she trip into with Dan? No spoilers, but it gets messy before it gets sorted! 
What I enjoyed: LOVED representation for POC and a main love couple who are both POC! I found every Alivia/Travis interaction adorable and wanting more. Really clean lust/love balance between building chemistry while showing depth of emotion. 
Overall, 4 ‚≠êÔ∏è 

Thank you to #netgalley for this eARC in exchange for an honest review!
#influencedlove #modernromancebook #newauthor #debutbook #bookreview #arcreader

For the past year or so I've been addicted to #modernromances. I read the Belltown Six Pack books over a year ago and loved them. So when my friend told me that @author.rebecca.connolly , @authorsophiasummers , and @authorhbmoore had done another series together I was so excited I got the first of the Lost Creek Rodeo books.

However I wasn't in the mood for a #cowboyromance yet. Then one day I stumbled upon the Northbrook Hokey Elite series and quickly began consuming them. Especially after discovering that they were loosely tied to the Belltown Six Pack. Which lead to bing reading the Lost Creek Rodeo series. 

Who knew I'd enjoy #sportsromance so much?! Each book was such a delightful read full of fun loveable characters who got me excited about sports (something I've never been intoüòÖ) with lots of kissing and of course a happily ever afterü•∞. The three series are loosely tied together but you could probably read each book as a stand alone. I'm only sad that they are overüòÖ.

*Note: There is super mild language in some of the books and intense making out, clean otherwise.

Happy Reading!

Do you have any #modernromancebook recommendations?

New Boss Old Enemy by Iona Rose 

Elana desperately needs a job.  She gets one only to find her new boss was a bully from her school days.  What is she to do?  Quit or stay and hope he doesn't remember her.
If you want to know what she does, read New Boss Old Enemy
